intro: Microloma calycinum, commonly known as the golden globemallow, is a perennial herb native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its compact, globe-shaped inflorescence composed of numerous yellow to orange flowers. The plant has hairy, glandular leaves and stems, which are typical of the Malvaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Microloma calycinum is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in arid gardens.
